content.question: A <math alttext="6 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sled starts from rest at the top of a hill and slides down the hill, as shown above. As the sled passes through a point that is <math alttext="30 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> vertically below its starting point, it has a speed of <math alttext="20 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m/</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. How much mechanical energy was dissipated by frictional forces during the interval shown?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
